data.title: Switzerland Weather in June 2024: Travel Tips for First-Timers
data.meta_description: Our guide to travel and weather in June in Switzerland includes average temperatures, rain, humidity, places to go, travel tips, and what to wear.
data.text:
The low elevations of Switzerland have warm weather and about 12 days of rain. The highest slopes at the highest ski resorts have conditions for skiing and other winter sports. The weather is comfortable for touring and hiking, and you can swim and enjoy the sunshine.

Climate Comparison (Averages) for Switzerland's Top Tourism Areas

Swiss weather turns warm in June in some of the low elevation cities and towns. There are approximately 7 hours of sunshine and 15Â½ to 16 hours of daylight. You could enjoy the long days with a variety of adventurous activities, sightseeing, and touring.

Lower altitude: Below about 500 meters (1,600 feet) where the big cities such as Lausanne, ZÃ¼rich and Geneva are, the weather is generally pleasant and warm. The daily highs reach 23Â°C (73Â°F), and together with the average 71% humidity, it feels very warm in the sunshine.

Higher altitude: Above 1,500 meters (5,000 feet) where the ski villages and resort towns such as Zermatt are, the daytime highs average 20Â°C (68Â°F). Nighttime lows average 8Â°C (46Â°F). Temperature decreases the higher the elevation.

The Best Places to Visit in Switzerland in June

Most tourists arrive from June to August to enjoy the great natural beauty of Switzerland in the summer and the urban highlights. Tourism is moderate or high in the cities. It is possible to do winter sports on the ski slopes on the peaks with the highest elevation such as on the Matterhorn.

1) ZÃ¼rich â Sightsee, Enjoy Outdoor Activities and Appreciate History

In June, ZÃ¼rich's weather turns warm by the end of the month, and is mild in the beginning of the month. It is Switzerland's main travel hub, and it provides access to the region via the international airport, the train hub station underneath, and the trams.

The daily average highs reach 22Â°C (72Â°F). Since there is sunshine about 7 hours a day on average, you might feel that it's hot if you are in the sun. When it isn't rainy, you could swim or bask along the shore at Lake ZÃ¼rich.

There are many public and private beaches along the lake shore, and on hot and clear days, the beaches are crowded. There are about 12 days of moderate rain. When it rains, you could visit one of the top museums such as the Swiss National Museum.

For more things to do, see visiting Switzerland in March.

2. Lauterbrunnen Valley â Enjoy Hiking and Sightseeing in a Beautiful Swiss Valley

Lauterbrunnen Valley is a beautiful valley with high cliff faces, 72 waterfalls, and quaint tourist towns in the famed Jungfrau valley region. It is famed since it is a beautiful ski resort area and a wonderful place for hiking and summer activities, and it's centrally located, near cities such as Bern.

Enjoy hiking during the long 16-hour days among legendary Swiss mountains, including watching rainbows in the spray of waterfalls. In terms of American scenery, it is like Yosemite Half Domes everywhere. It is a popular place to explore with many hiking trails.

Its elevation is 802 meters (2,631 feet), and the weather is pleasant, with average daily highs of 16Â°C (61Â°F) that feel warm since there are averages of about 8 hours of sunshine and 87% humidity.

Lauterbrunnen is 20 minutes from Interlaken by train and driving there is allowed too. For more information about Interlaken and travel there, see visiting Switzerland in March.

3. Zernez â Get in Some High-Altitude Hikes

Zernez is a tiny tourist town near the Italian border. It could be a base for excursions to Swiss National Park and other areas around it. It is 2Â½ hours northeast of Lugano. The elevation is 1,473 meters (4,833 feet), and there are a variety of accommodations including backpacker hostels.

Due to warm southern breezes, the average daily high reaches 14Â°C (57Â°F). The nightly lows dip to 4Â°C (39Â°F). The local bus service takes people up to Swiss National Park. In June, you'll have the opportunity to be among the first to hike in freshly opened areas after the snow melts.

The wilderness preserve is fairly high altitude and ranges from 1,400 (4,600 feet) to 3,173 meters (10,410 feet) above sea level. It is large and pristine with many animal species. The lower valleys are warm by the end of the month. There is the great natural beauty of snowy peaks with Mediterranean warmth.

4. Ticino and Lugano â Experience the Outdoors in the Warm Temperatures and Italian Cuisine and Culture in Switzerland

The canton of Ticino and its biggest city, Lugano, have more of a Mediterranean climate since Ticino is on the southern side of the Alps. The temperature is moderated by a big lake. The daily average high is about 23Â°C (73Â°F), and the low temperature averages 14Â°C (57Â°F).

The average humidity in June is 74%, and the humidity makes it feel a little muggy and like 27Â°C (81Â°F). There are an average of 11 days of low rainfall and an average of 7Â½ hours of sunshine. In the nice weather, you could walk the main shopping street called Via Nassa.

You might also enjoy just strolling in the parks, boating on one of the lakes, or rafting in the river. June would also be a good month to visit the three castles in Ticino.

Crowds and Costs for Traveling in June

June is the month with busiest tourism in ZÃ¼rich and other places. The beginning of summer and the long warm days attract many people. It is often bright and sunny. Some tourists arrive to ski on the high-altitude glaciered mountains. Most travelers enjoy the warm weather at low elevations and tour the cities and towns.

The peak season starts in the middle of June, and people flock to the countryside and mountains when schools are on vacation. Families particularly can be found enjoying the summer break. The cost for travel and hotel reservations become higher, making the expense of a Swiss vacation about the highest in the year.

Public holidays in June: The various cantons set their own holidays and observances. In June, there are no nationally observed holidays.

What to Wear in June

Bring clothing suitable for hot weather, swimming, and cold weather if you are planning to go into the mountains. Cover your skin in order to prevent sunburn.

The weather is unpredictable, and there might even be intense rain storms and hail. June is one of the rainiest months. So, take rain gear or a poncho.
